paper_abstract: In the context of 2-player removal games, we define the notion of invariant game for which each allowed move is independent of the position it is played from. We present a family of invariant games which are variations of Wythoff's game. The set of P-positions of these games is given by a pair of complementary Beatty sequences related to the irrational quadratic number alpha(k) = (1;(1, k) over bar). We also provide a recursive characterization of this set. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
